sub_title: Business Developer Plant Sciences Group at Wageningen University & Research
summary:
Comprehensive background in business development and project management of circular economy, waste management, and agri-food projects. Has eight years of international public-private partnerships management across 10 countries in Asia, Africa, and Europe, and being a liaison between cross-sectoral stakeholders (governments, private companies, NGOs, knowledge institutions). Have been gaining international experience from work and studies for the last 14 years. Possess a strategic and business mindset towards understanding what the market needs. 

Entrepreneurial attitude with sustainability and digital business experience. Passion for personal finance management and technological innovations in agri, food, and life science sectors. Excel at interpersonal communication to liaise with diverse clients, partners, and teams with interdisciplinary backgrounds. 

Highlights:
- Business Developer Plant Sciences Group at Wageningen University & Research. Exploring scope of collaboration with external partners and developing new projects across the different fields within Plant Sciences Group, including but not limited to agrosystems research, biointeractions & plant health, biometris, bioscience, greenhouse horticulture, field crops, and plant breeding. Also involved in the business development of Global Yield Gap Atlas, a global agronomic database platform containing data on yield gap of world’s key crops to private, public, and non-profit actors.
-  Liaison Officer Artificial Intelligence for Health for the alliance between Wageningen University & Research, Eindhoven University of Technology, Utrecht University, and University Medical Center Utrecht.
- Led business development for circular economy innovation in sanitation and solid waste management in India, Bangladesh, Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia, Tanzania (e.g. utilising waste for production of bio-fertiliser)
- Project Manager of Securing Water for Food project 'Circular economy with black and greywater recycling for exotic vegetable cultivation in South India' by USAID, SIDA, and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs
- Founded Shape of Green Business, a company that offered business coaching to early-stage start-ups in the field of agri, water and energy sectors for the Dutch startup visa application
- Worked at Safi Sana as a Wastewater Treatment Design Associate, supporting the design of wastewater treatment of the biogas production plant in Ghana
- Conducted a feasibility study on reusing wastewater from Pangasius ponds for irrigation of paddy fields as a climate adaptation measure in Mekong Delta, Vietnam

awards.title: Top 6 Finalists of the World Bank Youth Group Summit 2015: Crowdsourcing Solutions for Climate Change
awards.description:
The World Bank Group Youth Summit 2015 focuses on young's people role to fight against climate change. The Summit invites the brightest young minds from around the world to use their knowledge and creativity to crowdsource solutions for climate change that contribute to growth and development in developing and emerging countries. 

AQGRI+ submitted the business proposal of 'Franchise model of Aqgriponics system for urban and peri-urban agriculture production in India' to the World Bank. We got selected by the Committee as the Top 6 Finalists out of the submitted 350 proposals from more than 70 countries and was invited to present the proposal to the World Bank in Washington DC.

See article: https://blogs.worldbank.org/voices/six-finalists-announced-world-bank-group-s-youth-summit-2015-crowd-sourcing-solutions-climate-change

awards.title: Winner of the 1st place of International Climate Adaptation Business Challenge 2014
awards.description:
International Climate Adaptation Business Challenge 2014 is an international competition that is held by Knowledge for Climate institute and Climate-KIC to compete different business ideas from all over the world (out of 78 submissions from 28 countries) that address climate adaptation issue in their business model. The final stage of the competition was held at the Deltas in Times of Climate Change II conference in Rotterdam on September 25, 2014, where AQGRI+ won the 1st place of the competition.  

AQGRI+ uses wastewater as a resource and convert it into valuable products for customers. The vision is to address water and sanitation issue with innovative and market driven approach. In our AQGRI+ station, we have a unique integration of simplified and proven technologies to use the wastewater to produce three-valuable products; nutrient-rich irrigation water, high quality compost, and fish (by-product). We also offer service to municipalities an innovative and low-cost solution for the enormous wastewater problems where it usually gets discharged to river bodies causing water pollution and sanitation problems in developing countries.

See article: https://www.dutchwatersector.com/news-events/news/11743-deltas-2014-aqgri-wins-climate-business-challenge-award-for-water-re-use-stations-in-vietnam.html
awards.issuer: Knowledge for Climate Institute and Climate-KIC

projects.title: Reusing Wastewater from Pangasius Ponds for Irrigation of Paddy Fields as a Measure of Climate Change Adaptation in Can Tho city, Mekong Delta, Vietnam (Dissertation)
projects.description: My dissertation topic is aiming to set forth a climate change adaptation scheme by reusing wastewater from Pangasius (catfish) farms for irrigation of paddy fields in Can Tho city. I am targeting to establish a beneficial connection between agriculture and aquaculture sectors, the two main economic sectors in the Mekong Delta. I am expecting to present opportunities and constraints that can be put into further actions in the field of wastewater reuse in the Mekong Delta as a means of climate change adaptation.

contributors.headline: Business Developer Plant Sciences Group at Wageningen University & Research

projects.title: E-Way - Deployment of Wind-Sourced Supercharging Stations on Göteborg–Malmö Highway in Sweden
projects.description:
I participated in a summer school called theJourney by Climate-KIC, where I had to develop a business model that can help to mitigate climate change. 

My group/project is called 'E-Way'. I took the position of the Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) whose main responsibility was to identify potential market for the service. With my other group members, we put forward a business plan to sell superfast charging services for Electric Vehicle (EV) drivers on highways, in order to tackle two major issues of EVs, which are short range and long charging time. 

Together, we propounded a unique selling point by providing a super-fast charging service using energy partially from renewable energy (wind-source) and sustainable technology (battery storage) on highways where people are more willing to pay premium price. 

E-Way was nominated as the "Best Speech" during the Final Competition.

contributors.headline: Business Developer Plant Sciences Group at Wageningen University & Research

projects.title: Sustainable mobility through site-based travel planning in Budapest
projects.description:
The project was commissioned by REC (Regional Environmental Center) Hungary. The aim of the project was to propose a mobility scheme to improve the current state of infrastructure, modes of transportation, practices and perceptions of mobility in Budapest. 

As a manager team member,  I participated and actively engaged team work within the groups that were working in different topics. I was part of the presenters that showed the final results obtained in this project.

profile_positions.description:
A. Exploring scope of collaboration with external partners and developing new projects across the different fields within Plant Sciences Group, including but not limited to agrosystems research, biointeractions & plant health, biometris, bioscience, greenhouse horticulture, field crops, and plant breeding. Read more: https://www.wur.nl/en/research-results/research-institutes/plant-research/business-units.htm

B. Business development of Global Yield Gap Atlas - GYGA (www.yieldgap.org), which is a global agronomic database platform that offers robust estimates of yield gap and yield potential on existing farmland based on current climate and available soil and water resources. Results from GYGA can serve for a) strengthening market identification and investment prioritisation, b) undertaking risk analysis, c) providing a starting point to identify causes of yield gap in practice, d) monitoring impact over time. 

With this role, I am responsible for: 
1) Capturing and generating user data, intelligence, and insight for future customer-oriented development of the platform
2) Competitive landscape analysis, market positioning, and identification of unique selling propositions
3) Digital marketing to potential clients and partners
4) Approaching companies, public, and non-profit actors to explore their interest in capturing the values offered by GYGA via commercial license and sponsorship
5) Coordinated with several groups of WUR (incl. Business Development, Plant Production Systems at Wageningen University, and Earth Informatics at Wageningen Environmental Research Groups)
profile_positions.title: Business Developer Plant Sciences Group

profile_positions.description:
Wageningen University & Research (WUR) join forces together with Eindhoven University of Technology, Utrecht University, and University Medical Center Utrecht, in a strategic partnership called the alliance. With artificial intelligence (AI) for health as one of the prioritised themes, WUR contributes from the angles of environmental sustainability, food safety and food production, consumer behaviour, nutrition, and health. 

With this role, I am responsible for:
1) Provided insight into opportunities and options for initiating and organising research projects on the topic of AI for healthy lives
2) Mobilised and coordinated researchers on the topic of AI for healthy lives
3) Advocated scientific progress and innovation on the topic of AI for healthy lives that can be achieved together based on connecting internal and external partners of the alliance
profile_positions.title: Liaison Officer Artificial Intelligence for Health - Alliance (TU/e, WUR, UU, UMC Utrecht)

profile_positions.description: Shape of Green Business (www.shapeofgreenbusiness.com) helps non-EU entrepreneurs with business coaching and application support for the Dutch Start-up visa. I mainly deal with the business development of early-stage startups in the field of water, agriculture and energy sectors.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Worked at WASTE, a Dutch organisation specialised in business development and innovative financing in sanitation and solid waste management in developing and emerging countries. 

The highlights of responsibilities:
- Led business development for circular economy innovation in sanitation and solid waste management in India, Bangladesh, Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia, Tanzania (e.g. utilising waste for production of bio-fertiliser and biogas) under the FINISH Mondial programme by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs. See more at: finishmondial.org
- Project manager of Securing Water for Food project Round 4 'Circular economy with black and greywater recycling for exotic vegetables cultivation in Nilgiris District, India' by USAID, SIDA, the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and the Government of South Africa
- Designed and executed international Public-Private Partnership (PPP) projects addressing business development for circular economy in sanitation and solid waste management
profile_positions.title: Business Developer Circular Economy of Sanitation

profile_positions.description:
Working as an Independent Business Consultant at AQGRI+, a company offering service in business development for circular economy projects, in particular, waste recycling projects for agriculture and energy sectors in developing and emerging countries.
- Leading the overall strategy and management of the organisational, financial, and legal aspects of AQGRI+
- Offering a consultancy service in business development for circular economy projects, in particular, waste recycling projects for agriculture and energy sectors in developing and emerging countries
- Directing the R&D activities of the demonstration system of hydroponics in the North Holland
- AQGRI+ became the Winner of the 1st place in the International Climate Adaptation Business Challenge 2014 out of 75 applications from 28 countries (sponsored by Kennis voor Klimaat and Climate-KIC)
- AQGRI+ became the Top 6 Finalists of the World Bank Group Youth Summit 2015: Crowd-sourcing solutions for Climate Change out of 350 participants from 70 countries (sponsored by the World Bank)
profile_positions.title: Independent Business Consultant

company.name: Budapest University of Technology and Economics

profile_positions.company: Budapest University of Technology and Economics
profile_positions.description:
As a part of Pioneers into Practice (PiP) Programme, I did an International Placement at Department of Sanitary and Environmental Engineering of Budapest University of Technology and Economics (BUTE), which is a technical university with the main fields of activity in urban water management, water quality and flood control, water and wastewater technologies, public works, environmental and sanitary engineering. 

The output of my placement is a research report on 'The Comparison in Nutrients Recovery Technologies in Wastewater Treatment Plant in Hungary and the Netherlands'. With this research, the objectives are to understand the current regulations regarding nutrients recovery activities in wastewater treatment plants in Hungary and the Netherlands, to classify nutrient recovery technologies existing in the two countries, and to identify the challenges and opportunities in the field.
profile_positions.title: Climate-KIC Pioneer

profile_positions.description:
As a part of Pioneers into Practice (PiP) Programme, I did a Domestic Placement at Better Future Factory (BFF), who is a multi-disciplinary design, environmental and engineering company based in Rotterdam. I am responsible to develop a Preliminary Study of Technical and Business Viability for one of their Projects, named PolyMore, in India. 

PolyMore is an affordable recycling tool to recycle plastic waste into useful products (e.g. tiles, bricks, fishing ropes). The tools are offered together with a Business in a Box solution to spark local entrepreneurial activity.	The purpose of this study is to provide a reference for a Pilot Study of PolyMore in Nilgiris, Tamil Nadu, India. 

The output of the Placement is a document outlining the Preliminary Study of Technical and Business Viability of PolyMore for Recycling of PET Bottles for Tiles Production in Nilgiris District, Tamil Nadu, India. The Study focuses only on the production of tiles from recycled PET bottles using one of the PolyMore tools ‘The Melter’. With this Study, the end objective is also to observe if the tiles produced from PolyMore can be used in the construction of sanitation systems under the FINISH Programme undertaken by WASTE and FINISH Society.
profile_positions.title: Climate-KIC Pioneer

profile_positions.location: The Netherlands, France, the United Kingdom
profile_positions.description: Elected by the Climate-KIC community to lead the communication between the West Regions (Netherlands, United Kingdom, France) and the CKAA Board. I was responsible to stimulate the developments of CKAA activities within these three regions and to maintain contacts with local representatives from each region on behalf of the Board. It was critical for me in this position to be a good organiser and networker at the same time in order to be able to integrate different people for the accomplishment of a project.
profile_positions.title: Western Regions Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Worked with a client of WASTE, Safi Sana, which is a company that collects toilet and organic waste from slums to produce biogas and organic fertilizer and sell them to the market in Ghana, I contributed in the development of wastewater treatment plant (WWTP) design for their new future biogas plant site in the city of Ashaiman. I worked together with the technical manager of Safi Sana towards the detailed design of the site by looking at different WWTP technological options and scenarios, dimensioning and drawing the selected scenario, and developing the BOQ (Bill of Quantities) for the selected WWTP.
profile_positions.title: Wastewater treatment design associate

profile_positions.description:
The focus of the summer school is on Climate Change and Entrepreneurship. The 5-weeks summer school was aiming to develop a business model that can help to mitigate climate change. 

My group is called 'E-Way'. I took the position of the Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) in the project and was successfully able to identify the potential market for the product. My group was nominated as the "Best Speech" during the Final Competition.
profile_positions.title: Summer school (theJourney)

profile_positions.description: I contributed in reviewing the Personal Career Development Framework of the HR employees. The purpose of reviewing the framework was to know where the employees would like to go with their career path. I also assisted in the development of the survey concerning intergenerational aspect of the company.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
The purpose of the event was to sell second-hand goods and sell them at a really low price to the low-income people. I was chosen to be the Vice President of the event. I gathered and connected networks from outside to support the completion of the event. I worked closely with the President of the event to coordinate activities for other event organizers and participants, so that we could see the event running successfully. 

The result of the event was better than expected. We generated more money than expected and thus was able to donate more.

The idea of the volunteer project was to create a small library in a school of rural area and developed a reading programme for the kids. Together with my partner, we aimed to provide access for the kids to greater knowledge through availability of books surrounding them. 

I developed networks to obtain books from outside source and made sure that there were enough books to fill the library, while my partner focused more on developing the reading programme. I improved the existing condition of the library by repainting the wall and organized the furniture in such a way to make a small comfortable library. The library is right now still being used by the students, with more books being donated, and its size being already extended, showing that the project is still running and even developing.
